clinical_study.brief_title: Malglycemia in the Pediatric Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Population
clinical_study.official_title: Malglycemia in the Pediatric Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Population

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective chart review of patients who underwent a hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT) between 1994 and 2016 to evaluate incidence of malglycemia and the relationship to specific outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a retrospective chart review of patients who underwent a hematopoietic stem cell transplant between 2007 and 2016 to evaluate incidence and risk factors of malglycemia. The review will also aim to characterize relationships between specific outcomes and malglycemia in pediatric HSCT patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients experiencing malglycemia in primary admission for pediatric HSCT patients
primary_outcome.description: hypoglycemia (BG < 70 mg/dL), hyperglycemia (BG ≥ 126 mg/dL), or glycemic variability (σ ≥ 29 mg/dL)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with versus without malglycemia who experience infection
primary_outcome.description: It is hypothesized that patients who experience malglycemia will have an increased rate of post-transplant infections. This outcome will be assessed for differences in incidence based on malglycemia occurence

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine whether specific exposures are associated with increased occurrence of malglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of the outcome, malglycemia, with be assessed for differences in incidence that may occur as a result of age, medication exposures (use of glucocorticoids, asparaginase, total parenteral nutrition (TPN), or calcineurin inhibitors), underlying diagnosis, and transplant type

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival rate of patients with versus without malglycemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Transplant Day 0 through date of relapse or death
secondary_outcome.description: It is hypothesized that patients who experience malglycemia will have an increased rate of post-transplant mortality. This outcome will be assessed for differences in incidence based on malglycemia occurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of GVHD in patients with versus without malglycemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Transplant Day 0 through date of relapse or death
secondary_outcome.description: It is hypothesized that patients who experience malglycemia will have an increased rate of GVHD. This outcome will be assessed for differences in incidence based on malglycemia occurrence

intervention.description: Allogeneic and autologous stem cell transplants covering both malignant and non-malignant diagnoses.

study_pop.textblock: All patients who received hematopoietic stem cell transplants with the Bone Marrow Transplant Program at Children's Hospital Colorado from January 1, 2007 to July 31, 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 0 to 30 years old at time of transplant
- Bone Marrow Transplant (BMT) recipient at Children's Hospital Colorado (CHCO) between 1/1/2007 and 7/31/2016
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preexisting diabetes mellitus or known hyperglycemia
- Inadequate blood glucose data for analysis
